approx 10cm 4 inches from top to tip of toe 7 stitches x 10 row to 1 inch m o r e k n i t t i n g p a t t e r n s a r e a v a i l a b l e a t https //littlecottonrabbits com/ © copyright 2005 j u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 1 this is a little pattern for a mini christmas stocking it is knitted flat and seamed afterwards mainly because i don t enjoy knitting in the round but you could convert it to be knitted in the round if you prefer even though it is worked flat i use double pointed needles because during heel shaping you need to switch from working one side to the other if you don t have double pointed needles you can knit it on single points and slide the work from one needle to the other when it s time to work on the second heel half there are lots of ideas for adapting the design of this pattern for instance adding numbers to make an advent calendar or initials to personalise the stocking over on ravelry www ravelry com/patterns/library/mini-christmas-stocking-ornaments i prefer to knit the stocking on 2 75 mm needles with 4ply yarn but the pattern will knit up with whatever you prefer note obviously the larger the needle size and thicker the yarn the larger the finished stocking apart from the garter stitch top it is worked in stocking stitch knit on right side and purl on reverse i hope you have fun with the pattern if you d like to show us what you ve made please come and join the little cotton rabbits group over on ravelry www ravelry com/groups/little-cotton-rabbits a b b r e v i a t i o n s these decrease methods are described in detail on the excellent knitting help website http //www knittinghelp com/videos/decreases sssskk sslliipp sslliipp kknniitt slip a stitch as if to knit it to kk22ttoogg kknit 2 stitches together the right-hand needle slip a second stitch in the same pp22ttoogg purl 2 stitches together way slip both stitches together back to the left-hand needle and knit together through the back loops pp22ttoogg ttbbll purl 2 stitches together through back loops please note i use a cable cast on if you use a different cast on method you may need to adapt the pattern
